org.jpac

Class Decimal

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • org.jpac.Signal
        • org.jpac.Decimal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IoDecimal

    public class Decimal
extends Signal
    represents a decimal signal

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Decimal(AbstractModule containingModule, java.lang.String identifier)
      constructs a decimal signal without range check.
      Decimal(AbstractModule containingModule, java.lang.String identifier, double defaultValue)
      constructs a decimal signal with a given default value and without range check.
      Decimal(AbstractModule containingModule, java.lang.String identifier, double minValue, double maxValue)
      constructs a decimal signal with intrinsic range check
      Decimal(AbstractModule containingModule, java.lang.String identifier, double minValue, double maxValue, double defaultValue)
      constructs a decimal signal with a given default value and intrinsic range check

        public Decimal(AbstractModule containingModule,
               java.lang.String identifier,
               double minValue,
               double maxValue)
        throws SignalAlreadyExistsException
        constructs a decimal signal with intrinsic range check
        Parameters:
        containingModule: - module this signal is contained in
        identifier: - identifier of the signal
        minValue: - minimum value signalValid for this decimal
        maxValue: - maximum value signalValid for this decimal
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyExistsException

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(double value)
         throws NumberOutOfRangeException,
                SignalAccessException
        used to set the decimal to the given value
        Parameters:
        value: - value, the decimal is set to
        Throws:
        NumberOutOfRangeException
        SignalAccessException

      • setDeferred

        public void setDeferred(double value)
        used to set the Decimal from any thread, which is not a module and not the jPac thread The value is changed synchronized to the jPac cycle
        Parameters:
        value: - value, the decimal is set to

      • get

        public double get()
           throws SignalInvalidException
        returns the value of the decimal. If the calling module is the containing module the value of this signal is returned. If the calling module is a foreign module the propagated signal is returned.
        Returns:
        see above
        Throws:
        SignalInvalidException

      • exceeds

        public DecimalExceeds exceeds(double threshold)
        returns a process event (DecimalExceeds), which is fired, if the decimal exceeds the given threshold
        Parameters:
        threshold: - threshold to be supervised

      • fallsBelow

        public DecimalFallsBelow fallsBelow(double threshold)
        returns a process event (DecimalFallsBelow), which is fired, if the decimal falls below the given threshold
        Parameters:
        threshold: - threshold to be supervised

      • changes

        public DecimalChanges changes(double baseValue,
                              double threshold)
        returns a process event (DecimalChanges), which is fired, if the decimal changes above the given threshold in relation to the given baseValue
        Parameters:
        baseValue -
        threshold: - threshold to be supervised

      • changes

        public DecimalChanges changes()
        returns a process event (DecimalChanges), which is fired, whenever the decimal changes. CAUTION: may be fired unintentionally due to noise in the last decimal places

      • connect

        public void connect(Decimal targetSignal)
             throws SignalAlreadyConnectedException
        used to connect this decimal to another decimal. One decimal can be connected to multiple decimals. The connection is unidirectional: Changes of the connecting signal (sourceSignal) will be propagated to the signals it is connected to (targetSignal): sourceSignal.connect(targetSignal).
        Parameters:
        targetSignal -
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyConnectedException

      • connect

        public void connect(Decimal targetSignal,
                    DecimalMapper decimalMapper)
             throws SignalAlreadyConnectedException,
                    SignalAccessException
        used to connect this decimal to another decimal. One decimal can be connected to multiple decimals. The connection is unidirectional: Changes of the connecting signal (sourceSignal) will be propagated to the signals it is connected to (targetSignal): sourceSignal.connect(targetSignal).
        Parameters:
        targetSignal -
        decimalMapper -
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyConnectedException
        SignalAccessException
